result.markdown:
--- title: "Contrasts and multiple testing" --- ## Content - Contrasts - Multiple testing ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - specifying and calculating custom contrasts in factorial designs - determining the number of tests in a family that need to be corrected for - understanding how to correct _p_-values to account for multiple testing - listing multiplicity testing methods suitable depending on context ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 4](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/04-contrasts_multipletesting.html) of the course notes - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 3](https://stat.ethz.ch/~meier/teaching/anova/contrasts-and-multiple-testing.html) of @Meier:2022 - {{< fa book-open-reader >}} [One-way ANOVA example](/example/onewayanova.html) ## Complementary readings - @Gelman.Carlin:2014 - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 5 of @Maxwell.Delaney.Kelley:2017. - {{< fa book >}} Chapters 4 and 6 of @Keppel/Wickens:2004. ## Slides
